abstract.p: New York Yankees manager Joe Torre, discussing triumph of receiving third World Series ring, says he wants to continue managing 'for as long as it's still fun' (S)

block.p: As Joe Torre discussed the triumph of receiving a third World Series ring yesterday, the Yankee manager said that he ''wants to be around for a while'' and wants to continue managing ''for as long as it's still fun.''

The 59-year-old Torre has a contract that extends through the 2001 season and it has generally been assumed that he would retire from managing after next season. But Torre's comments about wanting to remain with the Yankees for a while seemed to open up the possibility that Torre would consider signing an extension.

The 59-year-old Torre has a contract that extends through the 2001 season and it has generally been assumed that he would retire from managing after next season. But Torre's comments about wanting to remain with the Yankees for a while seemed to open up the possibility that Torre would consider signing an extension.
''When I say a while, I mean this year and next year,'' Torre said. ''I don't know about beyond that. I'll keep doing this as long as it remains fun, and it's fun right now.''
Torre, who makes $3 million a year, has not talked to George Steinbrenner about his future because he will not make a decision until he sees how the 2001 season unfolds.
